revised_title: The Functional Significance and Structure of the Human Corpus Callosum
tldr: The author investigates the structure and function of the human corpus callosum using a special mode of preparation. They discover that the corpus callosum is not an interhemispheric commissure but a decussation of cortical fibers connecting to the basal ganglia. The study also reveals the existence of the crossed callosal tract, which plays a significant role in the brain's connectivity and function.
